pullRequest.body:
* `div_mod_eq_mod_mul_div` is a flipped version of [`mod_mul_right_div_self`](https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/blob/91334702431b8a7bf07f3f9e5696603de7b11fb6/src/Init/Data/Nat/Mod.lean#L50).
* `mul_div_mul_comm_of_dvd_dvd` is a flipped version of [`div_mul_div_comm`](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/b6cb80af68d53667dbbe8267f20ca075d5ffa953/Mathlib/Data/Nat/Defs.lean#L583).

These were found by [tryAtEachStep](https://github.com/dwrensha/tryAtEachStep).

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: 🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.
I'd rather remove the lemmas (and deprecate them properly).

Deprecated in https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13336/commits/671100db12b1e4dde3d988629c969001a9d7d358.

I wanted to replace the lemmas with `alias`, because I don't think it's possible because then there's no way to apply the `symm`.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9301453693/job/25599619984)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9301453693/job/25599619516)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9301453693/job/25599619766)

`Nat.mul_div_mul_comm_of_dvd_dvd`/`Nat.div_mul_div_comm` is supposed to mimic `mul_div_mul_comm`/`div_mul_div_comm`. Can you revert? (or maybe reintroduce `Nat.mul_div_mul_comm` instead of `Nat.mul_div_mul_comm_of_dvd_dvd` since I agree the name is strange)

Thanks! This raises the question whether having both lemmas is useful - but I think this can also happen in a follow-up.
maintainer merge

Thanks! This raises the question whether having both lemmas is useful - but I think this can also happen in a follow-up.
maintainer merge

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: deprecate Nat.div_mod_eq_mod_mul_div and Nat.mul_div_mul_comm_of_dvd_dvd
